surface_layer.definition: A retractile claw found in cats, used for predation and other functions.

deep_layer.mechanism: The claw is retracted and protracted through a combination of muscular action and ligament tension.
deep_layer.origin: Evolved as an adaptation for efficient predation in the Felidae family.

MECHANISM: Contraction of the Flexor Digitorum Profundus (FDP) muscle CAUSES protraction of the claw.
Relaxation of the Flexor Digitorum Profundus (FDP) muscle CAUSES retraction of the claw.
Tension in the Strong Dorsal Elastic Ligament (SDEL) CAUSES retraction of the claw.
Hyperextension of the distal phalanx (P3) CAUSES the claw to be sheathed.
